metadata.title: CVE-2016-3588 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.7.12 and earlier allows remoteauthenticated users to affect integrity and availability via vectorsrelated to Server: InnoDB.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3588` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-common - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.13-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
